introduction: This video provides an overview of containerization in software development. Containers are isolated environments that can be created and run in mere moments, allowing developers to work on applications without compromising on their local machine. They offer a full operating system at their core, ensuring consistent environments across different machines. The video demonstrates how to create a container using Docker, a popular container platform. It also discusses cloud platforms' support for deploying containers as standalone units and Kubernetes, a platform for creating container-based clouds.
